title: Uley
description: At West Hill, Uley, Gloucestershire, excavations revealed the remains of a multi-period ritual site. This site remained in use from the Neolithic period to the Middle Ages. An Iron Age sanctuary was replaced by a Romano-British temple dedicated to Mercury in the early second century A.D.

properties.description: Representative point of center of temple complex, after information in Woodward 1993, fig. 3, p. 6. Faint crop marks are visible in Google map imagery (2017)
properties.title: Imagery Location: Center of remains
